item.title: Foodies still can’t get enough of Maggie Beer
item.description: Online sales of Maggie Beer’s gourmet food and beverages soared during the first wave of the coronavirus pandemic as more people dined at home, with their meals inspired by her daily streamed cooking classes.

item.title: Premier’s fiery exchange with reporter
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews has refused to answer a series of hard-hitting questions about when distressed Victorian business owners can expect to start planning a future after the state’s harsh lockdown.

item.title: Man dead in alleged stabbing
item.description: A man is dead and a woman is assisting police after an alleged stabbing in Moreton Bay, north of Brisbane on Thursday morning.

item.title: Tycoon’s yacht trip ends in $4000 fine
item.description: A $4003 fine has been issued to the skipper onboard the luxury Lady Pamela yacht as police continue to probe how the construction magnate’s vessel cruised to Queensland.

item.title: Major reason for Woolies’ profit slide
item.description: Woolworths has reported a full-year profit plunge with rising supermarket sales during the coronavirus pandemic unable to shake off the financial wounds incurred in its hotel business.

item.title: Tattoo shop getaway driver’s big mistake
item.description: A getaway driver was nabbed because he didn’t turn his headlights on after a drive-by shooting at a tattoo parlour owned by ex-Richmond player Jake King.

item.title: Coaches want funding to develop not protect
item.description: Sydney Roosters coach Trent Robinson says the Rugby League Coaches’ Association doesn’t want to be “greedy”, but it is important the group receives funding to develop not protect coaches after a record number of coaches have been sacked this season.

item.title: Aussies shut out at borders given lifeline
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has signalled that Australians shut out by border restrictions will have right to appeal exemptions knocked back by state officials.

item.title: Police respond to bin man’s claims
item.description: Police have denied harassing a Melbourne man who was taking out his bins past curfew, saying officers had been hunting a car thief and their interaction with the man was “cordial”.

item.title: Sydney CBD coronavirus cluster grows
item.description: The Sydney CBD coronavirus cluster is continuing to grow, with five of Thursday’s nine new cases linked to the area.
